alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Nance; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:51AM CDT until July 29 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR NANCE...WESTERN YORK...HAMILTON...MERRICK AND WESTERN POLK COUNTIES... At 650 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near St. Edward to near Hordville to Stockham, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. At 647 AM CDT, emergency management reported 60 mph wind gusts near Aurora. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Polk around 655 AM CDT. Genoa around 700 AM CDT. Henderson around 705 AM CDT. Benedict and Lushton around 710 AM CDT. Stromsburg around 715 AM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 319 and 349. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
